jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Role

Taktile is building the world's leading software platform for running critical and highly-automated decisions. Our customers use our product to catch fraudsters, prevent money laundering, and expand access to credit for small businesses, among many other use cases. Taktile is already making millions of such decisions across the globe every day.

  • Taktile is based in New York, London, Berlin, and São Paulo.

  • Taktile was founded by machine learning and data science veterans with extensive experience building and running production ML in financial services.

  • Our team consists of engineers, entrepreneurs, and researchers with a diverse set of backgrounds. Some of us attended top universities such as Harvard, Oxford, and Stanford, and some of us have no degree at all.

  • Our team has accumulated extensive work experience at leading tech companies such as Google, Amazon, and Meta, startups, and the enterprise software sphere.

  • Our backers include Y Combinator, Index Ventures, and stellar angels such as the founders of Looker, GitHub, Mulesoft, Datadog, and UiPath.

  • We’re backed by some of the world’s leading investors and show great traction with scale-ups and large enterprises across the financial services and insurance industry. We are looking to build on this success by growing our sales team, professionalizing our go-to-market, and acquiring more customers.

That’s where you come in.

As a Senior Account Executive, you are core to our mission of building and expanding Taktile’s customer base in Latin America, ensuring our innovative solutions empower businesses to optimize their decision-making processes.

You will play a vital role in driving growth by creating a robust sales pipeline and guiding prospective customers through their buying journey with expertise and care. As a credible brand ambassador, you will represent Taktile in the market, fostering trust and building strong relationships with key stakeholders.

About You

  • You’ve met or exceeded your sales targets for 3-4+ years at $90K+ USD ACVs.

  • You have managed deal cycles of 3-6 months or more.

  • You know how to build strong customer relationships with senior customer stakeholders.

  • You’re curious and customer-centric, enjoying the process of learning about prospects' businesses and helping them solve challenges.

  • You’re humble and have a growth mindset, eager to learn new skills and methodologies and bring best practices into our business.

  • You’re collaborative and work well with your peers in Marketing, BDR, and Customer Success.

  • You’re creative and proactive—always looking for ways to stand out with prospects and improve the buying experience.

  • You have excellent written and spoken English and Portuguese skills and an exceptional feel for language and messaging.

  • You have experience selling SaaS/software subscriptions to Financial Services and/or start-up and scale-up businesses.

  • You have strong prospecting skills—and a willingness to use them.

What You'll Do

  • Sell Taktile’s innovative decisioning software solution to target customers and prospects in Financial Services to meet or exceed your revenue targets.

  • Develop a deep understanding of our target markets, ideal customer profile(s) (industry, account, and personas), and value proposition as well as competitive positioning.

  • Manage a pipeline of high-velocity, multi-stakeholder sales opportunities from lead to close, selling annual subscription contracts.

  • Source quality outbound sales pipeline from target accounts through prospecting.

  • Qualify and manage new opportunities generated by BDRs and Marketing.

  • Provide a fantastic buying experience for our customers.

  • Seamlessly hand over new customers to the Customer Success team.

  • Upsell existing accounts to generate add-on revenue.

  • Leverage best-practice sales methodologies such as MEDDICC and Challenger.

  • Use CRM and other sales tools such as HubSpot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, etc.

  • Report to VP Sales in weekly forecast meetings and 1:1s.

  • Provide feedback from the market to Product, Marketing, Business Development, and Taktile leadership to inform our product roadmap, target profiles, and go-to-market strategies.

Ideal, But Not Required

  • Experience working in an early-stage start-up (Seed - Series B).

  • Experience and strong interest in FinTech, data, and ML/AI.

Our Offer

  • Work with colleagues that lift you up, challenge you, celebrate you and help you grow. We come from many different backgrounds, but what we have in common is the desire to operate at the very top of our fields. If you are similarly capable, caring, and driven, you'll find yourself at home here

  • Be one of the founding team members of our Latin America offices.

  • Make an impact and meaningfully shape an early-stage company.

  • Experience a truly flat hierarchy and communicate directly with founding team members. Having an opinion and voicing your ideas is not only welcome but encouraged, especially when they challenge the status quo.

  • Learn from experienced mentors and achieve tremendous personal and professional growth. Get to know and leverage our network of leading tech investors and advisors around the globe.

  • Receive a top-of-market equity and cash compensation package.

  • Get access to a self-development budget you can use to e.g. attend conferences, buy books or take classes.

  • Use the equipment of your choice including meaningful home office set-up.

  • We're eager to meet talented and driven candidates regardless of whether they tick all the boxes. We're looking for someone who will add to our culture, not just fit within it. We strongly encourage individuals from groups traditionally underestimated and underrepresented in tech to apply.

We won't inquire about how you identify or if you've experienced discrimination, but if you want to tell your story, we are all ears.

Taktile is already making millions of such decisions across the globe every day.

Taktile is based in Berlin, London, and New York City. It was founded by machine learning and data science veterans with extensive experience building and running production ML in financial services. About the role

Taktile is a high-growth, post product–market fit start-up, on a fast trajectory to becoming market leader in the field of automated decisioning.

As a backend engineer starting your career, you will contribute to the expansion and improvement of our Data Marketplace and integration engine. These systems enable customers to access, evaluate, and combine data providers at scale, powering millions of automated decisions every day. Your work will help banks, fintechs, and enterprises fight fraud, expand credit, and enable financial access.

You’ll learn by working alongside experienced engineers on API aggregators, AWS, and complex backend systems, and you’ll grow your skills in building reliable, scalable software. This role is ideal for someone who is motivated to learn quickly, thrives in collaborative environments, and wants to make an impact early in their career.

What You'll Do

  • Build and maintain backend components in Python on AWS - from integrations to orchestration layers - while learning best practices in code quality, testing, and keeping CI/CD fast and reliable.

  • Support outcomes for the Data Marketplace: help onboard providers, implement versioning strategies, and contribute to efforts that reduce time-to-new-integration while maintaining reliability and cost-effectiveness.

  • Follow and apply integration standards: learn to work with API contracts/SDKs, resilience patterns (idempotency, retries, backoff), and operational guardrails that scale to millions of daily decisions.

  • Collaborate on projects from discovery to production launch—participating in RFCs, validating with prototypes, aligning stakeholders, and contributing to changes with observable impact.

  • Improve reliability and performance: support SLOs, instrumentation (tracing/metrics/logging), dashboards, and runbooks while gaining hands-on experience in reducing latency and improving MTTR.

  • Grow with mentorship: participate in design reviews, pair programming, and documentation efforts while learning from senior engineers.

  • Collaborate in the open: join daily syncs, planning, demos, and deep-dives; work with Product, Security, and Customer teams to turn real-world needs into simple, robust solutions.

Requirements

  • Taktile is a hybrid company with options to work from either our Berlin HQ, or the Iasi hub. Taktile will not cover relocation services for this role.

  • Fluency in English, both written and spoken, is essential as we operate in a hybrid environment requiring clear and effective communication.

  • Strong foundational knowledge in computer science or software engineering and a passion for simplicity, quality, and ownership.

Ideal, But Not Required

  • Exposure to serverless and event-driven architectures (e.g., Lambda, queues, streams).

  • Basic observability practices (tracing, metrics, structured logging).

  • Familiarity with AI-assisted development and code generation.

  • Fintech domain exposure (KYC, credit bureaus, fraud-prevention APIs).

  • Experience with internships, personal projects, or open-source contributions in backend development.

Required Experience

  • Hands-on experience programming in Python (through coursework, projects, or internships).

  • Exposure to public cloud environments (AWS preferred).

Our Offer

At Taktile, we are at the forefront of enabling millions of critical, data-driven business decisions around the world every day. Our AI-powered decision engine empowers businesses to automate and scale high-stakes decision-making with precision. Trusted by leading fintechs and banks globally, our product is integral to expanding access to credit, preventing fraud, combating money laundering, and tackling a wide range of other complex challenges. We've been named category leader in Decision Management Platforms multiple times and this is only the start!

Taktile is run by a global team based in Berlin, London and New York City. Some of us attended top universities such as Harvard, Oxford, and Stanford and some of us have no degree at all. Our backers include Y Combinator, Index Ventures, Tiger Global and stellar angels such as the founders of Looker, GitHub, Mulesoft, Datadog and UiPath. You'll be working with operators that scaled companies to IPO, venture capitalists, experts from traditional banking and former consultants. 

As our BDR Lead, you will play a critical role in driving pipeline growth and building a high-performing Business Development team. You will be responsible for managing, coaching, and scaling a team of BDRs to generate qualified leads for our sales pipeline. This is a leadership role with both strategic and operational responsibilities, ideal for someone passionate about coaching talent, optimizing sales processes, and driving results.

What You'll Do

 - Lead and coach a team of BDRs: Provide hands-on mentorship to your team, helping them hit and exceed pipeline goals.

 - Drive pipeline growth: Own the team’s outbound sales targets by ensuring consistent lead generation and high-quality outreach strategies.

 - Develop sales processes: Establish scalable workflows, templates, and best practices for prospecting, outreach, and lead qualification.

 - Recruit and onboard top talent: Hire, train, and onboard new BDRs to ensure their success in the role.

 - Monitor and analyze performance: Use data and analytics to track team performance, identify areas for improvement, and optimize campaigns.

 - Collaborate cross-functionally: Work closely with Marketing, Sales, and Operations to align on goals, campaigns, and handoff processes for leads.

 - Stay on top of trends: Keep up with industry best practices and emerging tools to enhance the team’s effectiveness and efficiency.

Ideal, But Not Required

 - Experienced in sales development: You have 3–5 years of experience in B2B sales, with at least 1–2 years managing or leading a BDR/SDR team.

 - Results-driven leader: You thrive in a metrics-driven environment, and you know how to set clear goals and inspire your team to achieve them.

 - A coach at heart: You enjoy mentoring and developing talent, and you have a proven track record of helping team members grow.

 - Strategic thinker and doer: You’re comfortable balancing high-level strategy with day-to-day execution.

 - Tech-savvy: You have hands-on experience with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) and outbound sales tools (e.g., SalesLoft, Outreach).

 - Collaborative communicator: You’re skilled at building relationships and working cross-functionally to achieve shared objectives.

Our Offer

 - Take ownership of a key role in building a scalable, high-performing sales development function

 - Receive a top-of-market equity and cash compensation package

 - Get access to a self-development budget that you can use to e.g. attend conferences, buy books or take classes

 - Join us onsite in our inspiring office spaces in Berlin, NY, or London and travel to quarterly team meetings around the world

 - Make an impact and meaningfully shape an early-stage company by creating new opportunities 

 - Experience a truly flat hierarchy. Interact with and learn directly from founding team members. Having an opinion and voicing your ideas is not only welcome but encouraged, especially when they challenge the status quo

 - Get to know and learn from experienced mentors such as the founders of Looker, GitHub, Mulesoft, Datadog, and UiPath

 - Use the equipment of your choice including meaningful home office set-up. 

 - Benefit from an onboarding and training path supported by best-in-class coaches to become a true expert in your field 

Our Stance

 - Work with colleagues who lift you, challenge you, celebrate you, and help you grow. We come from many different backgrounds, but what we have in common is the desire to operate at the very top of our fields. If you are similarly capable, caring, and driven, you'll find yourself at home here.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

Taktile is a high-growth, post product-market-fit start-up, on a fast trajectory to becoming market leader in the field of automated decisioning. We are looking for an Infrastructure Engineer to join our Platform team tasked with building and maintaining our robust cloud infrastructure. You'll be working at the intersection of infrastructure, engineering, and operations, creating systems that keep our platform scalable, reliable, and performant. This is a hands-on technical infrastructure role with real impact: you'll architect AWS environments, implement infrastructure as code, optimize CI/CD pipelines, and ensure our cloud resources are secure and cost-effective.

What You'll Do

  • Own AWS at scale: Operate multi-account AWS Organizations (SCPs, guardrails, budgets), IAM, networking, logging, and account vending.

  • Infrastructure as Code: Design, build, and maintain Terraform modules and CloudFormation stacks for core platform services and developer self-service.

  • CI/CD & automation: Create and maintain GitHub Actions workflows (build/test/release), reusable actions, and environment promotion.

  • Reliability & ops: Improve observability (CloudWatch, alarms, dashboards), backups, disaster recovery runbooks, and incident response automation.

  • Cost & performance: Implement tagging policies, budgets/alerts, rightsizing and lifecycle policies to keep spend in check.

  • Scripting: Write small tools and automations in Python/Bash to integrate APIs, enforce policies, and eliminate manual steps.

  • Collaboration: Partner with product engineers and SREs to deliver paved-road patterns and documentation.

Requirements:

  • Taktile is a hybrid company with options to work from either our Berlin HQ in Germany or the Iasi Hub in Romania. Taktile will not cover relocation services for this role.

  • Fluency in English, both written and spoken, is essential as we operate in a remote environment requiring clear and effective communication.

  • Strong engineering fundamentals with a passion for simplicity and precision

Required Experience

  • 5+ years in Infrastructure/Platform/SRE/DevOps roles, operating production systems in AWS.

  • Deep experience with Terraform (modules, workspaces, versioning) and CloudFormation (or CDK) in multi-account setups.

  • Proven track record building and maintaining GitHub Actions pipelines at scale (matrix builds, reusable workflows, OIDC to AWS).

  • Solid understanding of AWS IAM, VPC/networking, logging/monitoring, and account governance.

    • Act as a commercial checkpoint for deal structures, ensuring order forms and quotes meet internal standards

    • Identify inefficiencies and bottlenecks in the revenue funnel; drive cross-functional process improvements

    • Build and refine processes for professional services scoping, delivery, and margin analysis

    • Support sales enablement with operational playbooks and performance insights

    • Define and monitor key GTM KPIs and dashboards together with the data team

    • Partner with GTM leadership to build accurate forecasts and attribution models

    • Ensure visibility into delivery capacity, project timelines, and services profitability

  • Drive operational cadence and growth

    • Own the GTM operational cadence, including forecasting, QBRs, capacity planning, and pipeline reviews

    • Closely collaborate with Finance and GTM leadership during revenue and quota planning cycles

    • Take the lead for territory and quota planning and collaborate with GTM and finance leadership to align between top-down targets and rep-level deployment

    • Partner with leadership and sales enablement on roll-outs for changes in territory and quota design

  • Lay the Groundwork for Future Growth

    • Define and evolve the RevOps roadmap as we scale

    • Prepare to build and lead a RevOps function as company's needs evolve

  • Technical/quantitative background with experience in Python, SQL and APIs

  • Experience working with HubSpot (and Salesforce)

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Taktile is looking for an experienced Senior Contracts Manager & Legal Operations Specialist to build and own our contracts function from the ground up. You’ll serve as the primary legal point of contact, handling day-to-day contracting while creating the systems and processes that scale our legal operations efficiently.

You’ll independently manage a wide range of agreements—NDAs, vendor contracts, sales agreements, DPAs, and amendments—while knowing when to bring in our fractional General Counsels for more complex matters. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-moving environment, enjoys solving problems pragmatically, and can balance legal precision with business needs.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead drafting, review, and negotiation of standard commercial agreements

  • Support global sales teams with practical, timely contract guidance

  • Build and optimize legal infrastructure including templates, workflows, and automation

  • Implement scalable contract management systems and self-service tools

  • Triage and prepare complex issues for fractional GC review to maximize efficiency

  • Maintain contract compliance, version control, and lifecycle tracking

What You Bring

  • 8+ years of contracts or legal operations experience, ideally in SaaS or technology

  • Proven ability to negotiate and execute contracts independently

  • Experience supporting global teams and building legal processes from scratch

  • Strong commercial judgment, communication skills, and attention to detail

  • Proficiency with tools like Google Workspace, Slack, Notion, and DocuSign

  • You’re pragmatic, self-sufficient, and know how to design processes that empower teams and keep the business moving with confidence.
